title: NIFI-9619 Remove GPG key from Security Mailing List reporting
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9619 Removes the expired GPG key fingerprint from the Security Vulnerability Disclosure documentation. The difficulty of securely sharing a GPG private key among members of the Project Management Committee outweighs the benefit of supporting encrypted disclosure messages, so the most straightforward change is to remove the expired GPG key fingerprint and simplify the reporting instructions.

title: NIFI-9615 Extending capabilities of NAR provider with restraing, conflict resolution strategy and refactors to make it more flexible
body:
[NIFI-9615](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI-9615)

This is a follow up on NIFI-8519: the NAR Provider has been refactored for being more flexible (both in usage and with furher extensions). With this some feature has been added:
- Allowing providers to replace already existing files if certain conditions apply, using "conflict resolution strategies"
- Restraining NiFi from startup until the first fetch has been succeeded (optional)
- Adding a property to refine poll interval

title: NIFI-9578 NiFi user list no longer breaks if a user and group have the same id
body:
#### Description of PR

- ids of the entities are prefixed by their types to avoid id conflict in 3rd party table library
   For some authorizers the UUID calculation for users and groups based only on the name of the entity and a global seed.

title: NIFI-9611 Remove unnecessary references to nifi-processor-utils
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9611 Removes unnecessary references to `nifi-processor-utils` from multiple modules and adds references to `nifi-utils` where necessary.  Several modules had undeclared dependencies on `commons-lang3` through `nifi-processor-utils`. Removing and replacing references to `nifi-processor-utils` removes around 30 MB from the final NiFi binary.

title: NIFI-9608 Disable system-tests workflow for pull requests
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9608 Disables the `system-tests` workflow for pull requests. The `system-tests` workflow retains the scheduled execution configuration to run every 24 hours to provide opportunity for additional troubleshooting. Disabling the `system-tests` workflow for pull requests avoids automated build failures due to unresolved issues with system tests running on GitHub.

title: NIFI-9606 Remove nifi-security-utils from nifi-framework-api
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9606 Removes `nifi-security-utils` as a dependency in `nifi-framework-api`.  The `nifi-framework-api` module does not include any direct references to `nifi-security-utils`, and other modules that require `nifi-security-utils` already include direct dependencies. title: NIFI-8549 Upgrade MiNiFi sensitive properties algorithm

title: NIFI-9600 Remove Elasticsearch 2 Processors
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9600 Removes the `FetchElasticsearch` and `PutElasticsearch` processors based on the Elasticsearch 2 library and the deprecated Transport Client.  The last Elasticsearch 2 version reached [end of life](https://www.elastic.co/support/eol) in 2018.  Removing these processors eliminates the legacy Elasticsearch 2 dependency and related libraries in `nifi-elasticsearch-processors`. Additional changes include removing integration test classes and ignored test methods for the other deprecated processors that remain in the `nifi-elasticsearch-processors` module.

title: NIFI-9605: Docker Images  for OpenShift
body:
<!--

  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
  limitations under the License.
-->
Thank you for submitting a contribution to Apache NiFi.

Please provide a short description of the PR here:

#### Description of PR

The provided Docker images are not easily usable in OpenShift with its built-in security restrictions. To directly use those images you have to create specific Security Context Constraints (SCC) and give further capabilities to Service Accounts just to be able to have initContainers changing file ownership inside the images.
The new container image definitions, based on [ubi8/OpenJDK11](https://catalog.redhat.com/software/containers/ubi8/openjdk-11/5dd6a4b45a13461646f677f4), are fully compatible with OpenShift and have the right files and directories ownership from the start, allowing to use them without relaxing security constraints. That makes them usable by standard users who would not normally have the rights to create those SCCs.
Images definitions are provided for nifi, nifi-registry and nifi-toolkit, in folders named `openshift` alongside the `dockerhub` folders in their respective location.

In order to streamline the review of the contribution we ask you
to ensure the following steps have been taken:

title: NIFI-9481 Exclude Data Transfer REST methods from DoSFilter
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9481 Excludes Site to Site Data Transfer REST resources from the standard Denial-of-Service Filter configured for the Jetty Server.

S2S communication incorporates separate own timeout handling for transactions, and the DoSFilter can result in unexpected transmission failures when transferring large files using S2S with HTTP. The `DataTransferExcludedDoSFilter` is a custom extension of the standard Jetty `DoSFilter` that excludes REST resource methods having a Request URI that starts with `/nifi-api/data-transfer`.

Implementation changes include refactoring Jetty Server request filter configuration to a separate `RequestFilterProvider` interface with implementations for standard and REST API applications. Abstracting request filter configuration following this approach reduces the complexity of the `JettyServer` class and supports related unit testing improvements.

title: NIFI-9570 Separate classpath for NiFi Registry sensitive property pro…
body:
…viders

This PR creates `lib/spp` under NiFi Registry's lib directory to isolate all of the sensitive property provider dependencies, and also separates `NiFiRegistryPropertiesLoader` into it's own module. It then uses a similar approach from `NiFi` to load `NiFiRegistryPropertiesLoader` via reflection in `NiFiRegistry` using a special ClassLoader that has `lib/spp` resources.

title: NIFI-9571 Correct Session commit handling in PutTCP
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9571 Corrects `PutTCP` and `PutUDP` Process Session handling to call `commitAsync()` after transferring FlowFiles to a destination relationship. Changes for NIFI-9546 in #5639 removed some invocations of `commitAsync()` during refactoring. With the addition of the `SupportsBatching` annotation and the fact that these processors extend `AbstractSessionFactoryProcessor`, calling `ProcessSession.commitAsync()` directly is necessary.

Additional changes include adjustments to `AbstractPutEventProcessor` using a generic type for the message class. This avoids compiler warnings and provides type-safety for calls to the `EventSender`.

title: NIFI-6266 Correct proxy FTP connect handling
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-6266 Corrects proxy connection handling for FTP components and adds support for SOCKS proxy servers with authentication.

The current `FTPTransfer` class attempted FTP server host resolution using `InetAddress.getByName()` in order to pass an instance of `InetAddress` to Commons Net `FTPClient.connect()`.  Although `FTPClient.connect()` accepts a `String` for the host parameter, the `connect()` implementation performs the same `InetAddress.getByName()` resolution.  In environments where the NiFi system cannot resolve the destination FTP server address, the `InetAddress.getByName()` throws an exception.

To resolve this problem, a new `ProxyFTPClient` extends the standard `FTPClient` and overrides the `connect(String host, int port)` method to create an `InetSocketAddress` that allows the host to be unresolved.  This approach allows a proxy socket to pass the unresolved host to the proxy server, relying on the proxy server to perform name resolution.  Proxy server connections require FTP passive mode, which is the default setting for the `Connection Mode` property. In addition to overriding the `FTPClient.connect()` method, disabling the Passive NAT Workaround Hostname Resolver is also necessary.  Calling `FTPClient.setPassiveNatWorkaroundStrategy()` with a `null` value disables potential hostname resolution that could also cause transfers to fail when connecting through a proxy server.

Additional changes include refactoring `FTPClient` creation using a new `FTPClientProvider` that follows the same approach as the `SSHClientProvider`.  The `StandardFTPClientProvider` handles configuring processor properties and also disconnects the `FTPClient` on initial failures, such as authentication problems.  These changes also provided the opportunity to remove several unused utility classes.

title: NIFI-9563 Enable ListenTCP Pool Receive Buffers property
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9563 Removes the deprecation comments from the `Pool Receive Buffers` property in `ListenTCP`. Refactoring `ListenTCP` using Netty removed usage of this property, but it can be repurposed to control the Netty `ByteBufAllocator`.

The default Netty configuration uses the `PooledByteBufAllocator`, which aligns with the default value for the `Pool Receive Buffers` property.  Adding a new `BufferAllocator` enum as a property on `NettyEventServerFactory` provides the method for changing the Netty Channel Option to use the `UnpooledByteBufAllocator` when `Pool Receive Buffers` is disabled in `ListenTCP`.

title: NIFI-9438 Refactor sensitive-property-provider to multiple modules
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9438 Refactors the `nifi-sensitive-property-provider` module to the following separate modules based on various types of providers:

- nifi-property-protection-api
- nifi-property-protection-factory
- nifi-property-protection-aws
- nifi-property-protection-azure
- nifi-property-protection-cipher
- nifi-property-protection-gcp
- nifi-property-protection-hashicorp
- nifi-property-protection-shared

This approach allows for more specific dependency management within individual providers while still supporting unified access to provider implementations through the `nifi-property-protection-factory` module.

Refactoring into separate modules required some clarification and simplification of the `SensitivePropertyProvider` interface as well as the `StandardSensitivePropertyProviderFactory`. Instead of having a direct association between the command line argument values supported in the `PropertyProtectionScheme` enumeration, the `nifi-property-protection-api` module introduces a `ProtectionSchemeResolver` interface.  The `StandardProtectionSchemeResolver` encapsulates resolution from command line arguments to `ProtectionScheme` instances. This approach decouples the `SensitivePropertyProvider` implementation from the `PropertyProtectionScheme` enumeration and instead relies on registering the protection scheme path exposed through the `SensitivePropertyProvider.getIdentifierKey()` method.

Additional changes include renaming `AESSensitivePropertyProvider` to `AesGcmSensitivePropertyProvider` as well as removing and streamlining a number of unit tests that performed duplicative testing of AES-GCM cipher operations.

title: NIFI-9556 Upgrade Apache HttpClient to 4.5.13
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9556 Upgrades multiple revisions of Apache HttpClient 4.5 to 4.5.13 and also upgrades Apache HttpCore to 4.4.15. These upgrades address multiple vulnerabilities and bugs associated with earlier versions of Apache HttpClient.

Changes include the addition of dependency management declarations in the root Maven configuration to control version and exclusions of Apache HttpClient 4.5 and HttpCore 4.4 for both direct and transitive dependencies. This approach removes the need for individual version declarations and exclusions in multiple modules.

title: NIFI-9541 Remove Elasticsearch 5 Processors
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9541 Proposes the removal of Elasticsearch 5 Processors contained in the `nifi-elasticsearch-5-bundle`.

[Elasticsearch 5.0](https://www.elastic.co/support/eol) reached end of life on 2018-04-26. The last minor version, Elasticsearch 5.6, reached end of life on 2019-03-11.

The NiFi Elasticsearch 5 processors use the Elasticsearch binary transport protocol, which Elastic deprecated in version 6. NiFi 1.12.0 removed the `nifi-elasticsearch-5-nar` from the standard binary distribution, requiring a separate download from the Maven Central Repository. Continuing to support the Elasticsearch 5 processors will become more difficult without further Elasticsearch 5 client updates, and users who require this version can continue to download and run the most recent `nifi-elasticsearch-5-nar` from Maven Central. For these reasons, the Elasticsearch 5 processors should be removed from future releases.

In order to streamline the review of the contribution we ask you

body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9535 Upgrades Spring Framework libraries from 5.3.11 to 5.3.14 and includes the following additional upgrades:

- Upgraded Spring Security from 5.5.2 to 5.6.1

title: NIFI-7835 Add authenticated SOCKS and HTTP proxy support for SFTP
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-7835 Adds support for accessing SFTP servers through SOCKS 5 proxy servers that require authentication. Support for authenticated proxy server access also applies to HTTP proxy servers, resolving NIFI-7749.

NiFi SFTP components use SSHJ since version 1.10.0. SSHJ does not provide direct support for authenticated proxy server access, and the current NiFi implementation supports SOCKS and HTTP proxy access without authentication using a custom `ProxySocketFactory`. The `java.net.Authenticator` class does not support providing proxy username and password credentials for single instances of `java.net.Proxy`, instead requiring the use an `Authenticator` instance for the entire JVM using the `Authenticator.setDefault()` method. This approach is not suitable for NiFi components that may require different sets of credentials for different component instances.

This pull request integrates the [BrokeredSocketFactory](https://javadoc.io/doc/com.exceptionfactory.socketbroker/socketbroker/latest/com/exceptionfactory/socketbroker/BrokeredSocketFactory.html) from the [socketbroker](https://github.com/exceptionfactory/socketbroker) library to support authenticated access to SOCKS and HTTP proxy servers from NiFi SFTP components.

Runtime configurations can be tested using proxy servers that implement standard SOCKS 5 and HTTP CONNECT protocols. The following open source proxy servers can be configured with authentication for testing:

- [Dante](https://hub.docker.com/r/wernight/dante) SOCKS 5 Proxy
- [Tinyproxy](https://hub.docker.com/r/monokal/tinyproxy) HTTP Proxy
- [Squid](https://hub.docker.com/r/ubuntu/squid) HTTP Proxy

body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9509 Adds a `PatchedSFTPEngine` that extends the standard SSHJ `SFTPEngine` to workaround rename flag handling in SSHJ 0.32.0.

As described in [SSHJ issue 751,](https://github.com/hierynomus/sshj/issues/751) initial support for SFTP rename flags introduced communication problems for SFTP servers that do not support SFTP protocol version 5 or higher. This patched approach can be removed once a new version of SSHJ introduces similar conditional handling of SFTP rename flags.

title: NIFI-9507 Correct SSH Client handling on connect failures
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9507 Corrects SSH Client handling in all SFTP processors when initial connection or authentication fails.

The SSH Client instantiates and starts a Keep Alive Thread when `Send Keep Alive on Timeout` is enabled. When the initial connection or authentication fails, the NiFi `SFTPTransfer` class did not close the instance of SSH Client, resulting in the associated `keep-alive` thread continuing to run.

The refactored SSH Client handling delegates configuration and connection to a new `SSHClientProvider` interface and associated implementation.  The `StandardSSHClientProvider` translates processor properties to SSH Client settings then initiates connection and authentication.  The provider implementation closes the SSH Client instance and interrupts the Keep Alive Thread when encountering any exceptions. This change avoids leaving Keep Alive Threads running.

Additional changes include naming the Keep Alive Thread using the host and port properties associated with connection.

title: NIFI-9483 Exclude Log4j 2 log4j-core and related libraries
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9483 Excludes Log4j 2 `log4j-core` and related Log4j 2 libraries from the following extension modules that do not have runtime dependencies on Log4j 2:

- nifi-atlas-reporting-task
- nifi-druid-controller-service-api
- nifi-hive3-processors
- nifi-ranger-plugin
- nifi-registry-ranger-plugin

The `nifi-elasticsearch-5-processors` module requires Log4j 2 `log4j-api` to support Elasticsearch at runtime. Instead of `log4j-core`, the `log4j-to-slf4j` library provides runtime routing of Log4j 2 Loggers to SLF4J, removing the need for `log4j-core`.

These changes remove the need for any references to the Log4j 2 `log4j-core` library.

title: NIFI-9330 - Kafka 3.0 support
body:
#### Description of PR

Add new NiFi NARs `nifi-kafka-3-0-processors` and `nifi-kafka-3-0-nar`.  These are copies of the kafka-2-6 NARs as of git commit `b578f183cb593eae8a845d82f7fc28615e043ae9`, with minor changes to account for Kafka 3.0 method API updates.

To manage the size of the nifi-assembly binary distributable, we may consider removing certain versions of nifi-kafka.  At present, the following kafka nars are included:
- nifi-kafka-1-0-nar
- nifi-kafka-2-0-nar
- nifi-kafka-2-6-nar
- nifi-kafka-3-0-nar (NEW)

All nifi-kafka versions will continue to be built; this would just affect the content of the nifi-assembly binary.

The `nifi-kafka-3-0-processors` references to Scala remain at version 2.13, which is unchanged from `nifi-kafka-2-6-processors`.

Additional information about Kafka 3.0 may be found here:
- https://kafka.apache.org/downloads

Tested a single node NiFi instance and a three node NiFi cluster against a local Kafka 3.0.0 instance (single node) using topics with three partitions.  GenerateFlowFile was at the head of the data flow, with two PublishKafka_3_0 / ConsumeKafka_3_0 pairs, and terminating with a PutFile.

title: NIFI-9452 Generate a RuntimeManifest for NiFi at build time
body:
- Write additional fields to extnesion-manifest.xml for processors
- Update C2 model classes to support new fields for processors, properties, and scheduling
- Create converter between NiFi model and C2 model
- Create generator and execute during the build

For anyone reviewing this...

The idea is that the build will produce a jar named `nifi-runtime-manifest` which will contain the serialized JSON of the C2 `RuntimeManifest` for the overall nifi build.

After running a full build, the manifest can be found at:
```
nifi-manifest/nifi-runtime-manifest/target/classes/nifi-runtime-manifest.json
```

title: NIFI-9491 Exclude commons-logging
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9491 Excludes the Apache `commons-logging` from all modules and adds it to the list of banned dependencies for the Maven Enforcer Plugin.

The `jcl-over-slf4j` provides runtime routing of Apache Commons Logging to SLF4J and Logback, which overrides transitive references to `commons-logging` in numerous extension components. Excluding the `commons-logging` dependency and adding an already provided dependency reference to `jcl-over-slf4j` works with existing references to Apache Commons Logging while removing the unnecessary library from compiled artifacts.
